meanings.definition: To rearrange or reorganize something in a different way.
meanings.sent1: She rejigged her room by moving the furniture around.
meanings.sent2: The team rejigged their strategy for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent3: After the cat rejigged the yarn, it looked like a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces were rejigged into a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent5: He rejigged the recipe, adding a pinch of spice for flavor.

meanings.definition: To make adjustments or changes to something in order to improve it.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic rejigged the engine to make it run smoother.
meanings.sent2: She rejigged her resume to highlight her skills.
meanings.sent3: The clown rejigged his act to include more jokes.
meanings.sent4: The artist rejigged the painting, adding more vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: He rejigged the schedule to make it more efficient.
